Sentencas: Proton-conducting reversible solid oxide cells (PC-RSOCs) have attracted extensive attention due to their high efficiencies as energy conversion devices.
Titulo: Effects of porous support microstructure enabled by the carbon microsphere pore former on the performance of proton-conducting reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Generally, the performance of the cell is affected to a certain extent by the microstructure of the electrodes, which is closely related to the gas diffusion and surface reaction processes.
Titulo: Effects of porous support microstructure enabled by the carbon microsphere pore former on the performance of proton-conducting reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Herein, different contents of the carbon microspheres (CMSs) are used as the pore formers to control the microstructure of the hydrogen electrode.
Titulo: Effects of porous support microstructure enabled by the carbon microsphere pore former on the performance of proton-conducting reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Experimental results reveal that the porosity, line shrinkage, and thermal expansion coefficient of the hydrogen electrode support simultaneously increase with the CMS content.
Titulo: Effects of porous support microstructure enabled by the carbon microsphere pore former on the performance of proton-conducting reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The support with 30 wt% CMS presents high porosity (39.27 vol%) with uniform-size pores.
Titulo: Effects of porous support microstructure enabled by the carbon microsphere pore former on the performance of proton-conducting reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Subsequently, the corresponding single cells were fabricated successfully, particularly, the cell with 30 wt% CMS exhibiting the best electrochemical performance in both fuel cell (0.46 W cm(-2) at 700 degrees C) and electrolysis cell (1.41 A cm(-2) at 1.3 V and 700 degrees C) operational modes.
Titulo: Effects of porous support microstructure enabled by the carbon microsphere pore former on the performance of proton-conducting reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Further results demonstrated the highest performance was attributed primarily to the maximal three-phase boundary length, which mainly originates from the high porosity and unique microstructure of the hydrogen electrode.
Titulo: Effects of porous support microstructure enabled by the carbon microsphere pore former on the performance of proton-conducting reversible solid oxide cells
